title: 1 killed, 2 injured as portion of building's ceiling collapses in Kolkata's Park Circus
content: Residents said several families live on rent in the building and they had repeatedly requested the owner to repair the structure, which was in a severely dilapidated condition

title: NRI couple from Palakol dies in road accident in U.S.
content: The victims Krishna Kishore and his wife, Asha, natives of Palakol in West Godavari district, had settled in the U.S. a few years ago

title: BJP councillor R. Sreelekha says Thiruvananthapuram Mayor post was promised to her, but overlooked at last minute
content: ‘But I cannot give up the councillor’s post as I have to serve the people who voted for me’, says Sreelekha

title: Madras High Court dismisses cases filed by Minister I. Periyasamy, family against ED proceedings
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say, the petitioners could approach the adjudicating authority under the PMLA

title: Union Minister Manohar Lal appreciates AP’s progress in implementing energy efficiency programs
content: Manohar Lal Khattar emphasized need for States to intensify climate mitigation efforts through coordinated action involving governments, industries, institutions, and citizens, stressing that climate action cannot succeed without mass public participation

title: Supreme Court signs MoU with Bhutan apex court for exchange of law clerks, says CJI Surya Kant
content: “The initiative is aimed at strengthening judicial cooperation and enhancing institutional ties between the two countries,” says the CJI

title: Delhi riots case: Supreme Court denies bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, grants relief to five co-accused
content: The top court reasoned that Mr. Khalid and Mr. Imam stood “qualitatively on a different footing” from the remaining accused

title: Banks speed up response time, but technical shortcomings continue to fuel cybercrimes
content: According to data accessed by The Hindu, banks’ response time to police enquiries and notices averaged 15 to 20 days in 2024, depending on the bank. In 2025, this has come down to about a week.

title: Two injured in blasts in Manipur's Bishnupur
content: The house has remained abandoned since ethnic violence broke out in the state in May 2023, with its owner and his family currently living at a relief camp

title: IRCTC ‘scam’ case: Delhi HC asks CBI to reply to Lalu Prasad’s plea against charge framing order
content: Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma, however, refused to stay the trial, at this stage, in the case, and said it cannot do so without going through the probe agency's reply

title: Kalyan Singh's tenure as CM to be remembered for pushing nationalist mission in U.P.: Adityanath
content: Mr. Adityanath paid tributes to the former Chief Minister, fondly remembered as "Babuji", and recalled his role in restoring public confidence at a time when Uttar Pradesh was facing widespread disorder

title: Rajnath Singh commissions ICG’s pollution control vessel ‘Samudra Pratap’ in Goa
content: “The 114.5-metre vessel, built by the Goa Shipyard Limited (GSL), has over 60% of indigenous content. The 4,200-tonne vessel boasts a speed of more than 22 knots and an endurance of 6,000 nautical miles,” says officials

title: ‘People of Bengal embraced SIR as beacon of hope’: BJP's Suvendu writes to Chief Election Commissioner
content: Mr. Adhikari claimed that the CM’s call to “halt” the special intensive revision (SIR) is nothing short of an “admission of defeat”, and a “brazen attempt to perpetuate the electoral malfeasance” that has defined her tenure

title: Dialysis deaths: Medical negligence case filed against Haripad taluk hospital in Kerala
content: Two patients undergoing dialysis at the hospital on December 29 developed adverse reactions and died a day later

title: Srisailam temple management warns of action against prohibited activities in temple town
content: The warning by the temple management came in the wake of the staff of a satram organising New Year celebrations on December 31 night during which movie songs were played and the staff danced to them

title: Intense cold weather prevail at many places in Haryana, Punjab
content: At 4.5° Celsius each, Bathinda and Faridkot in Punjab also reeled under intense cold, recording similar minimum temperatures

title: Malayalam actor Kannan Pattambi, brother of filmmaker Major Ravi, dies
content: Kannan Pattambi had been an active presence in Malayalam film industry for years. He also acted in numerous television serials

title: Three minors held for pelting stones at religious procession
content: A girl who was part of the Om Shakti devotees participating in the procession sustained head injuries in the pelting of stones.

title: Three killed, ten injured as bus overturns on highway in Rajasthan
content: “An accident occurred at around 10 p.m. when the bus lost control and overturned on the highway. The cause of the accident is yet to be ascertained,” says Ahore Station House Officer

title: Indian Air Force’s Suryakiran Aerobatic Team to thrill Hyderabad skies on January 28 and 29
content: Formed in 1966, the Suryakiran Aerobatic Team is popularly known as the Ambassadors of the Indian Air Force

title: Gandhinagar typhoid surge: Amit Shah calls for swift government action
content: “Due to leakage in a water pipeline, cases of suspected typhoid, a water-borne disease, were reported in Sectors 24, 28, and Adivada area of Gandhinagar city a few days ago,” says the State Government

title: Assam hit by 5.1 magnitude earthquake; no casualty reported
content: A National Centre for Seismology report said the quake was recorded at 4.17 a.m. in Morigaon district on the southern bank of Brahmaputra, at a depth of 50 km

title: Delhi riots case LIVE: BJP welcomes Supreme Court's decision, says Congress should apologise for supporting 'tukde-tukde gang'
content: The top court on Monday denied bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, while it allowed the release of five other co-accused, including Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa Ur Rehman, Mohd. Saleem Khan and Shadab Ahmad, after distinguishing their alleged roles

title: Declare Kumbh Mela area restricted zone for non-Hindus before 2027 Ardh Kumbh: Shri Ganga Sabha
content: The Sabha president said that the government should identify such people and remove them from Haridwar

title: South Korean man stabbed to death by Indian live-in partner in Greater Noida; accused held
content: The deceased was identified as Duck Hee Yuh, a South Korean, who was living at ATS Pious Hideaways in Sector 150 in Gautam Buddh Nagar district

title: Many participate in pallankuzhi contest in Mylapore
content: Vincent D’Souza, director of the festival, said that concerts will be held at the Kapaleeswarar Temple from 7 a.m. to 8 a.m. from January 8 to 11

title: Trump’s list of nations whose immigrants receive welfare in U.S. does not mention India
content: The ‘Immigrant Welfare Recipient Rates by Country of Origin’ list has about 120 nations and territories, including Pakistan and Bangladesh

title: VCK to give more responsibilities to women and youth
content: Apart from district secretaries, each district unit equivalent to one assembly constituency will also have office bearers within the district

title: Centre relaxes norms for start-ups to avail funds from DSIR
content: Union Science and Technology Minister Jitendra Singh announced the removal of the three-year viability criteria for deep-tech start-ups to avail financial assistance of up to ₹1 crore from DSIR

title: Ending child marriages in Bengal: From a ‘hopeless end’ to endless hope
content: As West Bengal battles one of the highest incidences of child marriage in the country, a silver lining has emerged in State’s Murshidabad district, where 7 gram panchayats have been declared free of child marriage. Shiv Sahay Singh, meets the girls who are resisting child marriage, and NGO workers, panchayat functionaries, and district officials who have joined the fight against the practice

title: Tapovan tree felling plan brings Sena factions on the same page against BJP
content: A temporary stay has been given by the regional bench of the National Green Tribunal and the Bombay High Court after the greens had approached them against the government plan

title: Despite Shah’s ‘NDA govt.’ stand, EPS says AIADMK will form govt. on its own
content: No one is safe under the DMK regime and people are living in fear. But, the Chief Minister is not worried about this; upcoming poll will end dynasty politics in T.N., says the AIADMK chief

title: Stone-pelting during religious procession in Bengaluru’s J.J. Nagar; case registered
content: The devotees alleged that stones were thrown at the procession from nearby areas, resulting in injuries to a minor girl.

title: BJP leader’s call to ‘lock up’ Lakshmir Bhandar beneficiaries during polls sparks row in West Bengal
content: TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee accuses BJP of indulging in “feudal and patriarchal barbarism by urging husbands to lock up their wives at home, so women empowered by Lakshmir Bhandar can’t step out to vote”.

title: Aircraft manufacturers must deliver on time to the IAF: Air Chief Marshal
content: IAF Chief congratulates ADA for 25 years of LCA Tejas; DRDO chair stresses importance of developing indigenous cutting-edge technology to minimise India’s dependence on imports

title: Amit Shah dubs the DMK government the most corrupt in the country
content: Its sole objective is to make Chief Minister M.K. Stalin’ son Udhayanidhi the next Chief Minister. Time has come to wipe out the family rule in Tamil Nadu, the senior BJP leader and Union Home Minister says in Pudukottai

title: Ramanaidu accuses Jagan of betraying Rayalaseema interests
content: Water Resources Minister says YSRCP spreading false propaganda on irrigation projects, claims coalition government spent ₹8,000 crore in 18 months against ₹2,000 crore in five years during Y. S. Jagan Mohan Reddy’s tenure

title: CITU calls upon workers to make February 12 general strike a big success
content: The five-day 18th CITU All India Conference ends with an impressive rally of thousands of workers and union leaders at Visakhapatnam culminating in a public meeting

title: Inspections at railway station parking lots flag safety concerns
content: Fire and Rescue Services inspections at parking facilities of Ernakulam Junction (South) and Ernakulam Town (North) stations flagged lapses such as lack of functional fire hydrants, outdated fire extinguishers and inadequate emergency preparedness

title: Rajnath Singh to commission Coast Guard’s new pollution control vessel on January 5
content: The ship’s high precision operations and speed capabilities significantly enhances the ICG’s pollution response, fire-fighting and maritime safety and security capabilities

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader says he got death threats after opposing Bangladeshi cricketer in IPL
content: Anand Dubey claims he received abusive calls from Bangladesh after demanding a ban on Bangladeshi players; BCCI confirms Mustafizur Rahman’s release from KKR squad

title: BJP leader Javadekar calls on Vellappally
content: While BJP described it as a friendly visit, it comes amid perceptions of Vellappally having recently moved closer to the CPI(M) and Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Residents protest for new vehicular subway on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: They want the underpass to curb accidents on an accident prone stretch on the narrow service lane. Municipal officials said the road crossing had been in use since it was a narrow single-lane road many years ago

title: Plea ignored, hope rebuilt: CPI(M) delivers new house to Kochu Velayudhan in record time
content: After his plea turned away unopened by Union Minister Suresh Gopi, the CPI(M) steps in, raising funds and handing over a new house worth ₹11.5 lakh

title: Congress, CPI(M) cross swords over VACB recommendation against Satheesan
content: P. Rajeeve dismisses Congress’s attempt to portray Satheesan as a victim of LDF's political witch-hunt. Congress leaders say no funds collected from abroad was credited to Satheesan’s accounts

title: ₹12,900 crore sanctioned for railway projects in Kalyana Karnataka, says Somanna
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has given a clear message that politics must be kept out of development works, according to the Union Minister

title: Six youth held for selling narcotic tablets in Ranipet
content: The police say investigation found that the gang procured the Tapentadol tablets from pharmacies in Mumbai via courier

title: Soumya Swaminathan to inaugurate The Hindu Sustainability Dialogues at SIMATS Chennai
content: The programme, to be held at Saveetha Medical College, Thandalam, Chennai, will centre on practical and forward-looking solutions to address India’s growing environmental challenges

title: India has overtaken China in rice production, says Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: The Agriculture Minister also hits out at Congress labelling it as a ‘factory of lies’ for its campain against the new rural jobs Act

title: Satheesan to present blueprint for Congress poll campaign at party camp on Monday
content: As per the plan, conceived with the help of poll strategist Sunil Kanagolu, candidates will be declared in two phases. K.C. Venugopal asks party leaders to refrain from projecting themselves as candidates

title: Fifteen years on, 36 accused in Paravur sexual exploitation case still at large
content: Trial of six accused in case is set to begin on Monday. The trial court has acquitted 13 accused as the survivor reportedly turned hostile or failed to identify them

title: Chitra Santhe reflects Karnataka’s cultural ethos: CM Siddaramaiah
content: Chitra Santhe, an annual open-air art fair organised by the Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath, draws artists and visitors from across the country

title: Mortal remains of Punjab man who died in Russia-Ukraine war brought back
content: The older brother of the deceased Mandeep Kumar appealed to the Union Government to take appropriate steps to prevent recruitment of Indians in the Russian army

title: VACB recommends CBI investigation against Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan for alleged FCRA violation
content: Recommendations based on its findings that Satheesan may have violated the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act, (FCRA) 2010, by marshalling foreign funds through U.K.-based charity foundations, ostensibly to rehabilitate 2018 flood victims in his constituency in Paravur, Ernakulam

title: Congress turning Ballari into ‘republic’ of Bharath Reddy, says Joshi
content: The Union Minister seeks the arrest of Ballari City MLA for ‘being the reason behind’ the recent clash

title: Kogilu Layout evictions: Organisations place demand before govt. during public meeting
content: The demands include permanent rehabilitation for the evicted families, issuance of property deeds or occupancy certificates to rehabilitated families, temporary arrangements for basic facilities at the demolition site, and an assurance that the evicted families will not be forced to move from the area

title: Narayana lays stone for school being set up by Waqf Board in Nellore
content: Said to be the first such institution, it is meant to meet the educational needs of the marginalised sections of society

title: Steelers escape Ravens' late push, win AFC North title
content: In a rock fight that morphed into a fourth-quarter track meet, Pittsburgh edges Baltimore to advance.

title: Falcons fire Morris, Fontenot despite hot finish
content: The Falcons have fired coach Raheem Morris and general manager Terry Fontenot after two straight disappointing seasons.

title: Rodgers fulfills Steelers' 'vision,' delivers AFC North
content: The Steelers placed their belief in Aaron Rodgers in the offseason. On Sunday night, the veteran QB showed why they were right to do so, leading Pittsburgh to a 26-24 win over Baltimore and the AFC North crown.

title: QB Sorsby, top player in portal, commits to TTU
content: Former Cincinnati quarterback Brendan Sorsby, the top player in the NCAA transfer portal, is committing to Texas Tech, he told ESPN.

title: Johnson rips Bears' offense after loss to Lions
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson wasn't happy with his team's offense in a 19-16 loss to the Lions while QB Caleb Williams admitted Chicago came out "flat."

title: Booker hands OKC rare loss with game-winning 3
content: Suns star Devin Booker drained a step-back 3-pointer with 0.7 seconds left to hand the Thunder their sixth loss this season.

title: Eagles stand by rest call despite losing 2-seed
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni stood by the decision to rest most of his starters in a Week 18 loss to the Commanders despite it costing Philadelphia a chance for the No. 2 seed.

title: Becht rejoins Campbell, transfers to Penn State
content: Former Iowa State standout Rocco Becht, one of the most coveted quarterbacks in the NCAA transfer portal, committed to Penn State, he told ESPN in a phone interview Sunday, a program that will allow him to continue to play for coach Matt Campbell.

title: Fans, Bills bask in glow of stadium's swan song
content: In what is likely to be the final game at Highmark Stadium, the Buffalo Bills on Sunday handled the New York Jets, 35-8, much to the delight of their loyal fans, who often braved wet and frigid elements in the Orchard Park, New York facility for 53 years.

title: The NFL playoffs are here! Our guide to all 14 teams, from favorites to underdogs
content: The 2025 NFL playoff field is set, and an exciting wild-card round looms. Here's everything to know about the teams vying to win Super Bowl LX.

title: NFL draft order for Round 1: The first 18 slots are set, and the Raiders will pick at No. 1
content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order -- plus each team's top need -- after the regular season.

title: Sack records: Garrett makes history; Broncos' D four shy of team record
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher breaks the single-season sack record, and the Broncos' defense comes up short.

title: We answered seven questions about the Falcons' coaching, GM moves
content: Even a four-game win streak to end the season couldn't stop the firings, so where do the Falcons turn now?

title: NBA insiders predict 2026: Why LeBron, trade sagas, expansion news could rock the league
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the stars, sagas and storylines that will dominate 2026.

title: SEC: 11 tournament hopefuls, with one unexpected Final Four candidate
content: The SEC may not be able to replicate last season's success, but the March Madness potentials field remains strong.

title: Fantasy football year in review: 2025 takeaways and a look ahead to 2026
content: A summary of the best fantasy performances, biggest storylines, surprises and disappointments, along with the usual dose of historical perspective.

title: Amorim wants control at Man United, but outburst could cost him his job
content: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim is frustrated at not being able to choose his transfers himself. But by speaking out, he has put his job in danger.

title: No Maresca, no problem? Chelsea defy Man City late
content: All signs pointed to a routine win for Pep Guardiola's side, but Chelsea ended a turbulent week positively.

title: CFP semifinals first look: Previewing the penultimate round
content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

title: NFL draft prospects with a true Round 1 grade: 11 players who are clear first-rounders
content: We'll see 32 picks in Round 1 on April 23, but which prospects have actually earned a first-round grade? Right now, there are 11 in this 2026 class.

title: Guess who's back? Tyson Fury's many retirements -- and returns -- explained
content: Tyson Fury is no stranger to ceremonially ending (and restarting) his career, sometimes within months. Here's every time he did it before, and what came next.

title: Serrano has options if she stays at featherweight
content: Amanda Serrano got back to winning ways in her return to 126 pounds, and she plans to stay in that division.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Aston Villa to move for Marmoush?
content: Aston Villa are interested in signing Manchester City forward Omar Marmoush. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Mustafizur Rahman row: Bangladesh government imposes indefinite IPL telecast ban
content: Bangladesh has indefinitely banned all Indian Premier League broadcasts and promotions. This drastic step follows the removal of Bangladeshi bowler Mustafizur Rahman from the Kolkata Knight Riders squad, a move the government deems inexplicable and angering to its citizens.

title: 'Can pray for bail after one year': Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam to stay in jail
content: The Supreme Court rejected the bail pleas of Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the Delhi 2020 riots case, stating their roles were central and on a different footing from other accused. However, bail was granted to Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa Ur Rehman, Mohd. Saleem Khan, and Shadab Ahmad.

title: Delhi man beaten, wife molested, son stripped and thrashed in full public view
content: A dispute over a residential gym in Laxmi Nagar led to a violent assault on January 2. The gym's caretaker allegedly attacked the owner, molested his wife, and stripped and beat their son on the street. Police have arrested the main accused, while three others remain at large.

title: Shooters walked in, fired, and vanished: AAP sarpanch killed in Punjab - video
content: An AAP sarpanch, Jarmal Singh, was shot dead at a wedding venue in Amritsar by two gunmen. The brazen attack, captured on CCTV, saw the assailants approach and fire a single shot to his head before fleeing. Gangsters have claimed responsibility for the premeditated killing.

title: Palo Alto exec sees AI agents as risk; threat that Salesforce CEO hints renaming co after
content: Tech giants are betting big on AI agents, with Salesforce even considering a name change to 'Agentforce'. However, security experts warn these powerful tools could become the next insider threat.  A recent incident saw Chinese spies using AI to attempt breaches at numerous companies, highlighting the potential for AI to amplify cyberattacks.

title: Gold price today: How much the yellow metal costs in your city; check rates
content: Gold prices surged on Monday, recovering from last week's decline. February gold futures on MCX rose by Rs 1,509, reaching Rs 1,37,270 per 10 grams. This rebound was driven by geopolitical concerns in Venezuela and anticipation of US economic data, with global Comex futures also seeing a significant gain.

title: Indore deaths: Waterborne outbreak declared epidemic; supply shut, chlorination underway
content: Indore's health administration has declared a waterborne disease outbreak in Bhagirathpura an epidemic after 10 deaths. Specialized teams from central and state governments are investigating the contamination source. A high-level meeting was held to coordinate efforts with national and state experts.

title: AI debate: Mathematician Joel Hamkins warns; ‘LLMs give wrong answers’
content: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: Dwayne Bravo reveals MS Dhoni's on-field leadership masterclass
content: Dwayne Bravo revealed MS Dhoni's astute man-management, recalling an instance where Dhoni advised him against diving to field, emphasizing his bowling value over saving runs. This insight highlights Dhoni's ability to leverage players' strengths, fostering trust and a consistent team culture. Bravo felt Dhoni valued his specific contributions, leading to greater confidence on the field.

title: Ten tech trends to watch in 2026
content: After years of AI hype, 2026 brings a reality check. Companies need to prove their billion-dollar bets are worth it. Data centres are spreading globally, straining power grids. AI agents are moving from pilots to production. Robots are getting smarter. New hardware forms are arriving. Meanwhile, tech billionaires keep getting richer. The gap between hype and deployment is shrinking fast, and 2026 could turn out to be a real pivoting year.

title: Coding debate: Google engineer’s post viral; calls it ‘most divisive subject’
content: A Google principal engineer's post about AI transforming coding went viral, highlighting how Claude Code generated a complex system in an hour. While acknowledging the code isn't perfect, she emphasized its potential as a starting point. The engineer noted the divisive nature of coding agents within the developer community, attributing the controversy to broader industry and job market concerns.

title: Do you use aluminum foil to store or bake food? Doctor explains when you need to be cautious
content: Studies reveal that aluminum foil can leach unsafe levels of metals into food, particularly with acidic, salty, or spicy items cooked at high temperatures. This excess aluminum intake over time may contribute to bone problems, kidney strain, and nerve-related issues. Experts advise using steel, glass, or ceramic containers for storage and avoiding direct contact between foil and certain foods.

title: 'Step up when it matters': Mustafizur Rahman's message after KKR snub
content: Mustafizur Rahman was bought by KKR for Rs 9.20 crore at the auction last month, a move that underlined his value in T20 cricket. However, the franchise later released him following directives from the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) amid political tensions related to minority issues in Bangladesh.

title: ‘Cocktail 2’ release date locked? Here's what we know
content: Fans eagerly awaiting the sequel to the 2012 hit 'Cocktail' can rejoice as 'Cocktail 2' is slated for a September 2026 release. This strategic six-month gap after Shahid Kapoor's 'O' Remeo' in February allows both films to establish their unique identities. The movie is currently in its final stages, with a strong focus on its integral music.

title: Air India to replace CEO Campbell Wilson? N Chandrasekaran looking for new executive
content: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson to say ‘tata’? Tata Sons is exploring a leadership overhaul at its airlines business, with chairman N Chandrasekaran in talks with senior global aviation executives as he seeks faster execution and on-ground improvements at Air India.

title: Venezuela crisis fueling Indian oil stocks! RIL hits 52-week high; ONGC up 1%
content: Indian energy stocks surged on Monday, driven by geopolitical shifts in Venezuela. Reliance Industries hit a 52-week high, while ONGC, HPCL, IOC, and Oil India also saw gains.  Speculation is rife that a US-led restructuring could unlock significant unpaid dividends for ONGC from its Venezuelan investments, potentially boosting its financials.

title: One behind Don, chasing Sachin - Root's Sydney epic pushes him into cricket's elite
content: Joe Root's magnificent century in the fifth Ashes Test brought him closer to cricket's most revered records. His 41st Test hundred, equalling Ricky Ponting, and 17th score of 150-plus, place him among legends like Bradman and Tendulkar. Root's modern-era dominance is undeniable, with more centuries since 2021 than any peer.

title: Gold price prediction today: What is the price outlook this week? Top factors to watch
content: Gold price prediction today: Manav Modi, Senior Analyst, Commodity Research at Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd believes investors should continue to buy gold on dips. He shares his views and recommendations for gold investors and key levels to watch out for in the near term:

title: Saudi Arabia rolls out new saudization rules with SAR 8,000 wage for engineers
content: Saudi Arabia has introduced new Saudization rules to boost local employment in engineering and procurement jobs. Engineers in private and non-profit sectors will now receive a minimum wage of SAR 8,000, while companies must hire more Saudi nationals across key roles. The measures aim to improve job opportunities, strengthen workforce participation, and raise workplace standards nationwide.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside the private life of Aaron Rodgers’ wife
content: Aaron Rodgers, the NFL veteran, has been involved in a lot of messy public relationships but now, he has declared himself to be a married man. It has been more than six months since Aaron Rodgers has revealed he is married but his wife, Brittani, has stayed out of the spotlight. While this has sparked chaos, here's everything known about Brittani.

title: 'History will tell': Internal conspiracy? Maduro’s son's message for 'traitors' after father’s capture
content: Venezuelan dictator Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores have been captured following a US military operation and are facing narco-terrorism charges in New York. Maduro's son, Nicolas Maduro Guerra, a lawmaker also implicated in drug operations, has warned of betrayal within the ruling movement and called for public mobilizations to counter the 'external aggression'.

title: Astronomers identify a planet that does not orbit the Sun
content: Astronomers have directly observed a free-floating planet, comparable in mass to Earth, roaming the Milky Way. Discovered via gravitational microlensing due to its brief light curve, this rogue world is not bound to any star. Its motion suggests ejection from a planetary system, hinting at a potentially vast population of such solitary planets.

title: India's 0-2 loss vs SA: Shubman Gill seeks 15-day Test camps
content: Following a home Test series defeat, Indian captain Shubman Gill has proposed 15-day red-ball camps before each Test series to the BCCI.  He emphasised the need for better preparation, citing recent tight schedules. The board is reportedly open to giving Gill more input in team planning, though the packed calendar presents challenges for implementing these camps.

title: Natalia Bryant reacts to Vanessa Bryant’s New Year photo
content: Vanessa Bryant welcomed 2026 with a striking solo Instagram photo featuring a bold Western-inspired look. The post drew widespread praise, including a heartfelt two-word reaction from daughter Natalia. Vanessa also shared family moments, posting a ranch-style New Year photo with her daughters and a cozy Christmas snapshot. Together, the posts highlighted confidence, family unity, and festive warmth.

title: Stocks to buy: What's the outlook for Nifty for this week? Check top recommendations
content: Stock market recommendations: Sudeep Shah of SBI Securities recommends buying CESC, and Indian Bank as the stop stock picks for the week starting January 5, 2026. Here is his view on Nifty, Bank Nifty:

title: Tempers flare! Naseem Shah vs Kieron Pollard verbal spat steals the spotlight - video
content: A fiery exchange between Naseem Shah and Kieron Pollard marked the ILT20 final, adding drama to the title clash. Naseem later dismissed Pollard, playing a pivotal role in Desert Vipers' dominant 46-run victory and maiden ILT20 title win.

title: Dalit teen thrashed, stripped and filmed by attackers for online comment in Bareilly
content: Bareilly police have arrested three people, including two minors, in connection with the abduction and assault of a 16-year-old Dalit boy. The incident occurred on December 31 after a social media argument. The victim was allegedly taken to a secluded spot, stripped, and beaten. The assault was filmed. Two other accused are currently absconding.

title: Rupee outlook: Do Venezuela crisis, Trump action signal rough ride for Indian currency?
content: The Indian rupee is facing a volatile week, having already slipped significantly against the dollar. Political uncertainty in Venezuela and broader global tensions are raising concerns about further depreciation. Bankers anticipate the rupee could weaken to Rs 90.50-91 per dollar before potential intervention by the Reserve Bank of India.

title: What is quiet firing: A new workplace trend or a serious phenomenon?
content: Quiet firing describes a subtle but damaging workplace practice where employees are slowly pushed out through silence, exclusion, and shrinking responsibilities rather than formal termination. Often mistaken for a passing trend, it reflects deeper leadership failures and risk avoidance. The practice thrives in disengaged, remote workplaces, carrying serious psychological costs for employees and long-term consequences for organisations.

title: Venezuelan President Maduro flashes peace sign while in custody — watch
content: Nicolas Maduro, Venezuela's former leader, has been seen in US custody. Videos show him arriving in New York City and being escorted by law enforcement. President Donald Trump announced the arrest following a military action. Maduro faces US drug-trafficking charges and is being held at MDC Brooklyn. The United States plans to oversee Venezuela's transition.

title: T20 WC: Bangladesh wants its games shifted out of India; BCB cites player safety
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has decided not to travel to India for the T20 World Cup, citing security concerns and requesting a venue change. This decision follows the exclusion of star bowler Mustafizur Rahman from the IPL, sparking outrage and calls for relocation to Sri Lanka.

title: After Venezuela, is Greenland next target? Trump’s remarks spark unease in the Arctic
content: Donald Trump's remarks about needing Greenland for national security, citing Russian and Chinese ships, have sparked outrage.  His administration's hints at annexation, amplified by a social media post, were met with strong rebukes from Denmark and Greenland, emphasizing mutual respect and territorial integrity.  Both nations stressed their commitment to joint Arctic security.

title: 'Bangladesh is not Pakistan': Tharoor slams BCCI decision over Mustafizur's release
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has strongly criticised the BCCI's decision to ask Kolkata Knight Riders to release Mustafizur Rahman, calling it an "appalling" and "unnecessary politicisation of a sporting decision.

title: Travis Kelce hints at retirement timeline after Chiefs’ season-ending loss
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce faces a crossroads after the team's season ended with a loss.  He is considering retirement, weighing his future with the Chiefs against personal commitments.  Kelce expressed pride in his team's resilience despite the difficult season.  His decision on returning will be made after careful consideration and family time.

title: 'If they don't help on Russian oil issue...': Trump's new tariff warning to India; praises PM Modi
content: US President Donald Trump has warned India of increased tariffs if it does not reduce its oil trade with Russia, linking the threat to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. Trump cited India's continued purchase of discounted Russian crude as a point of contention, despite previous claims of a commitment from Prime Minister Modi to cease such trade.

title: Somnath Swabhiman Parv: 1,000 years of unbroken faith
content: A thousand years after Mahmud of Ghazni's devastating attack, Somnath Temple stands as a testament to India's enduring spirit.  Despite repeated invasions, the shrine's restoration, marked by its 1951 reopening, symbolizes resilience.  This enduring symbol of faith and civilization continues to inspire, mirroring India's own resurgence and commitment to global welfare.

title: "I Cant Walk Anymore": Afghan Migrant Dies On Snowy Route To Iran
content: Habibullah set off from his home in western Afghanistan determined to find work in Iran, only for the 15-year-old to freeze to death while walking across the mountainous frontier.

title: Eva Schloss, Auschwitz Survivor And Anne Frank's Step-Sister, Dies At 96
content: Eva Schloss, the Auschwitz survivor who dedicated decades to educating people on the Holocaust and was the step-sister of diarist Anne Frank, has died aged 96, her foundation announced Sunday.

title: No Junk Food Ads To Air Before 9 pm In UK
content: The ban -- targeting ads for products high in fat, salt or sugar -- is expected to remove up to 7.2 billion caloriesfrom children's diets each year, according to the health ministry.

title: US Attacks Venezuela LIVE: "It Could Be Against Any State Tomorrow," Says Venezuela On US Strikes
content: US-Venezuela Conflict Live News: Venezuela has warned that recent US military action against Caracas could set a dangerous global precedent, with the country's defence minister cautioning that such moves threaten the international order.

title: What Supreme Court Said Denying Bail To Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam
content: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to grant bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, agreeing with Delhi Polices argument that the two accused stand on a "qualitatively different footing" compared to others in the case.

title: 'Don't Believe Ukraine Stuck Putin Residence': Trump Rejects Russia's Claim
content: Trump told reporters that US officials have determined that Ukraine did not target a residence belonging to Russian President Vladimir Putin in a drone attack last week, disputing Kremlin claims that Trump had initially greeted with deep concern.

title: How A Trader Bet On Maduro's Downfall And Made A Profit Of 3.93 Crores
content: A new account on the Polymarket placed over $30,000, approximately Rs 27 lakh, on the Venezuelan President's ouster and made a mammoth profit of nearly $400,000, roughly Rs 3.93 crore.

title: Video: Bengaluru Woman Opens Car Door During Fight With Husband, Triggers Panic
content: The video of the incident, recorded from a car travelling behind the taxi, shows the cab taking a sharp left turn and driving with the rear door wide open. The woman is seen using her leg to keep the door open.

title: Andhra Techie, Wife Killed In US Crash Days After Trip To India
content: A pall of gloom has descended over the town of Palakollu in Andhra Pradesh following the death of a Telugu couple in a horrific road accident in the United States, just 10 days after they returned from a trip home.

title: In UP Crackdown, Illegal Religious Structures Razed, Power Theft Plugged
content: Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal has seen a major administrative crackdown combining late-night action against power theft and decisive steps against illegal encroachments on government land.

title: China's Xi Takes Veiled "Bullying" Dig At US After Venezuela Power Grab
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping has called on major powers to take a lead in "respecting the development path of other nations" in a veiled dig at the United States's sudden power grab in Venezuela and abduction of its president, Nicolas Maduro.

title: "Serious Political Mistake": K Kavitha Slams BRS Over Assembly Boycott
content: K Kavitha also questioned Karnataka's move to raise the Almatti dam height, warning it could cost Telangana nearly 100 TMC of water.

title: Madhya Pradesh Officer Suspended Over Controversial Remark In Official Note
content: Anand Malviya, the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) of Dewas, was suspended for serious negligence, indifference, and misconduct in the discharge of official duties.

title: "Evidence Of Criminal Conspiracy": Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam Denied Bail
content: The Supreme Court today denied bail to student activists Sharjeel Imam and Umar Khalid, who had challenged the Delhi High Court order denying them bail in a case under the stringent Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, or (UAPA).

title: "Zero Illegal Aliens Allowed In US In Last 7 Months": Trump's Top Quotes
content: United States President Donald Trump on Thursday set out plans to make the country "stronger than ever." In a televised address to the nation, Trump strongly criticised the Biden administration.

title: Video: UP Man Forces Dog To Drink Alcohol, Gets Arrested
content: A man has been arrested here for allegedly subjecting a dog to cruelty and forcing it to consume alcohol after a video of the incident surfaced online, officials said on Monday.

title: Andhra Airport Test Flight Triggers Credit War Between Political Parties
content: The successful test flight at Bhogapuram Greenfield International Airport near Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, has brought the long-pending international airport closer to becoming operational. However, the milestone has also sparked a political row

title: Man Thrashed, Wife Molested And Son Stripped By Group Of Men In Delhi
content: A man was thrashed, his wife was allegedly molested, and their son was stripped naked on a street and beaten up by a group of men in Delhi's Laxmi Nagar.

title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal On Why Co-Founders Left, Gig Work, Childhood Trauma
content: Speaking on entrepreneur Raj Shamanis podcast, Deepinder Goyal said that the term "co-founder" should not be conflated with permanence.

title: Endless rains to El Nino: How climate has stopped being seasonal — explained
content: Seasonality works like a traffic signal system when it functions properly, everything moves in order, but when the signals fail or change unexpectedly, confusion and disruption spread across both nature and society. It is like a ship that has already struck an iceberg: while it has not completely sunk, water is flooding the lower decks, and the window for preventing catastrophic failure is rapidly closing.

content: the playoffs kick off with the Los Angeles Rams at the Carolina Panthers, followed by the Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears . on Sunday, the red-hot Houston Texans hit the road to face the Pittsburgh Steelers .

title: Testing grit and willpower with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: Jags resurface Sean Payton's 'small-market' comment to lead Week 18 trolls
content: Pittsburgh hung on to defeat the Baltimore Ravens 26-24 in a wild "Sunday Night Football" matchup . the Steelers miss a field goal attempt as time expires . it's the final week of the regular season, and they are already in postseason form .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . the unofficial kick off to trade season happened on Dec. 15, with nearly 90% of players becoming eligible to be moved .

title: Tracking coaching changes: Falcons fire Raheem Morris after two seasons
content: the Falcons are the third team to fire their head coach during the 2025 season after the Tennessee Titans and New York Giants also made changes . sources say the team fired Morris and general manager Terry Fontenot after two straight disappointing seasons . their exits came hours after Atlanta wrapped up an 8-9 season with a 19-17 win over the Saints .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams
content: the 2026 offseason has begun for the 18 teams that didn't make the postseason . we have next steps for all 18 franchises . our NFL Nation reporters picked out two key offseason priorities for the teams they cover and weighed in on most interesting coaching situations .
